result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arraignment on April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:18 AM Defendant KYLE J WILBER in court via Zoom, in custody.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court - DE qualifies for Pub. Def. (one has not yet been appointed), advises DE of his right to have attorney and Prelim rights. DE waives right to have attorney at prelim and wishes to proceed today.   Dep. N. Thornborrow sworn & testifies. Witness id's DE.  Cross-exam.  Objection - not testified to - sustained.  ADA Kaupie - Victim is present in courtroom.  Court advises DE he will not be allowed to testify today.  State moves for bind over.  Court finds State has met burden of proof, finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial.  ADA Kaupie - State requests 30 days to file information as new charges will be added.  Arraignment scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with HJM 2-29-1984, directly or indirectly, victim's residence or place of employment.  Stay at least 1,000 feet away from victim at all times.    No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

01:21 PM Defendant KYLE J WILBER in court with attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge.  Defendant KYLE J WILBER in custody, via zoom.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
